benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/paymentMethods/{paymentMethodId}/setDefault - Set the default payment method

covered: PUT - Valid Request: Successful 204 flows with required header only, with payAllUnpaidInvoices=true, with pluginProperty, and with optional X-Killbill-Reason/Comment; audit logging verified.
PUT - Non-Existing Resource: 400 for invalid UUID formats; 404 for non-existent account/payment method, method not owned by account, and account with no payment methods.
PUT - Concurrency: Concurrent requests result in exactly one default payment method; system consistency asserted.

Input validation and robustness: Missing required header (400), unauthorized access (401), service unavailable/timeouts (503/504), SQL injection blocked (400/422), boundary tests for UUIDs and pluginProperty size, unexpected extra query param tolerated.
Regression behavior: Switching defaults clears the previous default.
gaps: PUT - Idempotency: Repeating the same PUT with the same paymentMethodId should be validated to ensure no side effects and still return 204.
Query parameter validation negatives: payAllUnpaidInvoices with non-boolean values (e.g., foo) not tested; pluginProperty malformed formats (CSV vs multi, duplicates) not covered.
PluginProperty boundary negatives: Exceeding any documented maximums or very long values not tested; URL-encoding handling not validated.

Content negotiation and headers: Behavior with unexpected request body and/or mismatched Content-Type not tested (expect 400/415 or ignore); verify error responses use Content-Type application/json; confirm 204 responses have no body.
State integrity on failure: No scenario asserts that on 4xx/5xx the prior default remains unchanged and no invoice payment attempts occur.
Authorization depth: 403 Forbidden for authenticated but unauthorized users (RBAC) not covered if applicable.
Combination coverage: payAllUnpaidInvoices=true together with pluginProperty not validated together.
Audit on failures: Ensure no audit entry is created on failure and that Reason/Comment are stored only on successful changes.
recommendations: Add an idempotency scenario: invoke the same PUT twice for the same paymentMethodId; assert 204 both times, single default, and no duplicate audit entries.
Add negative query param tests: payAllUnpaidInvoices with invalid values should yield 400; cover malformed/duplicated pluginProperty and values exceeding documented limits.
Add request-body/Content-Type tests: send a JSON body and/or wrong Content-Type and assert 400/415 or that the body is ignored; verify error responses are application/json and that 204 has no body.
Add failure-state integrity checks: after a failing call (e.g., non-existent paymentMethodId), assert the default stays unchanged and no invoice payment attempts are made.
If RBAC applies, add a 403 Forbidden scenario for authenticated users lacking permission to change defaults.
Add a scenario combining payAllUnpaidInvoices=true with pluginProperty to ensure both are honored simultaneously.
Document and enforce pluginProperty constraints; add a negative case that exceeds max entries or value length.
Move TC25 (accessibility) to documentation testing scope; it does not validate this PUT endpoint behavior.
